title: Mideast in Pictures: Juicy harvest, less juicy business!
content:
Freshly picked strawberries are packed into boxes before delivery to local markets, in a greenhouse in Jubara village near the West Bank city of Tulkarem, March 4, 2021. (Photo by Nidal Eshtayeh/Xinhua)
TULKAREM, West Bank, March 5 (Xinhua) -- It's strawberry harvest time in West Bank!
But Palestinian strawberry growers have less joy this year as the sales are hit by the COVID-19 pandemic that forced the closure of markets in West Bank cities on weekends as part of the measures to contain the virus' spread.
A Palestinian farmer picks strawberries in a greenhouse in Jubara village near the West Bank city of Tulkarem, March 4, 2021. (Photo by Nidal Eshtayeh/Xinhua)
A Palestinian farmer shows freshly picked strawberries in a greenhouse in Jubara village near the West Bank city of Tulkarem, March 4, 2021. (Photo by Nidal Eshtayeh/Xinhua)
A Palestinian farmer picks strawberries in a greenhouse in Jubara village near the West Bank city of Tulkarem, March 4, 2021. (Photo by Nidal Eshtayeh/Xinhua)
Palestinian farmers pick strawberries in a greenhouse in Jubara village near the West Bank city of Tulkarem, March 4, 2021.
